See Supplemental Information –Endnotes.AerCap’s Emissions in 2022
•AerCap’s emissions increased in 2022 
relative to 2021 for two principal 
reasons: 
•The acquisition of GECAS led to an 
increase in the number of employees 
and office buildings, resulting in a 
larger Scope 1 and 2 Emissions 
footprint, as well as increased 
Business Travel emissions. In 
addition, AerCap’s fleet nearly 
doubled as a result of the acquisition, 
which increased the Scope 3 
Emissions of our owned aircraft
•The recovery of air travel to more 
normal levels following the Covid-19 
pandemic led to an increase in Scope 
3 Emissions of our owned aircraft
